intro: Tetranthera propinqua, commonly known as the small tetranthera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
